comments.text:
If you resort to popping pimples,
Use the back, looped side of a bobby pin. (Not the side you open to stick 
you hair in. And make sure it is clean)
Place so the loop is directly around your pimple. And pull up,down,left, or 
right. It will hurt, but the puss will come right out.﻿
comments.author: howie wolf

comments.text:
Okay, I'm 13, so you can imagine how many pimples kids my age get. I don't, 
and here's what I do:

Wash face with warm/hot water,
Apply baking soda to the face (but it shouldn't be wet, just damp)
Scrub your face with the baking soda until you feel like your skin has been 
exfoliated,
Wash the baking soda off,
Get rubbing alcohol on a paper towel or (preferably) an alcohol swab and 
sterilize your open pores, 
Get some face wipes with witch hazel in them and pat them on your face, 
don't rub them.

Your skin will feel tight on your face, but this just means that the witch 
hazel closed your pores. This is to keep any new bacteria from creeping 
into your skin and causing another inflammation (a pimple)! I haven't had a 
blemish since I started this, so I hope you try it!﻿

I had super bad acne and I used to try everything! I did everyone and 
nothing was working for me. The only thing that worked was ACCUTANE! 
I'm not a dr. So I'm not saying you should but I'm saying it worked for me 
and a recommend talking to your dr and seeing if you can get on it. 

It has a list of tons of bad side effects but so far I've only had dry 
skin, lips and hair ( which means I don't have to wash it everyday. Yay!) ﻿

comments.text:
Never take advice about medicine, health or diet from places like this. 
Some of it might be true, some might be misunderstood and plenty may be 
actually harmful and even dangerous.
You want real advice on looking after your skin ? Look for information from 
a dermatologist and even then make sure they are not some quack. Never 
believe anything a cosmetics company tells you on face value and never 
believe some alt med peddler trying to sell you 'ancient wisdom'.﻿
